name: ARMA: Gold Edition
description: ARMA: Gold is pack of ARMA: Armed Assault and an expansion pack ARMA: Queen's Gambit. ARMA is a first person tactical military shooter with large elements of realism and simulation. This game features a blend of large-scale military conflict spread over large areas alongside the more closed quarters battle.
minimum_requirements: Minimum OS: Windows XP or Windows Vista Processor: 2.5Ghz Intel P4 or AMD Ahtlon processor Memory: 512MB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA Geforce 6600GT with 256MB VRAM Pixel Shader 2.0 or ATI Radeon x800 with 256MB RAM Pixel Shader 2.0 DirectX®: DirectX 9.0c Hard Drive: 6 GB Sound: OpenAL sound compatible audiocard

reviews.review_text: Do not buy this game expecting to be playing multiplayer the servers were run by gamespy and they have shut down but if you are looking for a single player MILSIM go ahead and buy its a great game :)

ARMA: Gold Edition is just that  GOLDEN  As if any more explanation would be necessary, but I will give it anyway.  This game was a literal gift to me and thanks to the good will of a friend. We decided to play this game due to the absolute crappiness of our PCs at the time. So really we played this out of necessity than anything else. By some miracle it turned out this game has a ridiculously fun and longlasting cooperative game mode. WARFARE. Many great memories have been had there. I would list them but they are too many in number and too crazy in content to by included in a steam review. All the strange situations you find yourself in are the reason I went so screenshot happy with this game.  Playing this oldie was a gamble at first, but it turned out to be a gem. I'm still yet to find an equally fun but simple experience on the later ARMA games.   10/10

The squad system is broken, the controls are all over the place and the mouse aiming is incredibly difficult to fine-tune properly. Those are three pretty important things that the majority of PC games, ESPECIALLY first person shooters, get right (except for the squad system, not every game has one, but most games that do, hey, at least it works in those games) and, since it's been a pretty long time since the original game's release, I doubt we'll get a fix for any of these issues. This game had so much potential...

I have to say, I'm impressed. I've played many games that were old, most were fun...ish. But this game? I love it! It does -however- remind me of the Far Cry series (not that the gameplay is the same, but that 1 and 3 were great, but 2 was the B-grade movie that didn't come to the theater). I definetly recommend this game to people that love simulators, and have patience (you know, that thing that CoD players lack). This game represents real-life military strategy, and is NOT recommended to people that play CoD, or people that rage to often (WARNING: this game will probably give you a headache even if you enjoy it, especially the continous un-needed radio talk in campaign).
